results.title: The Computer wore tennis shoes
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Anderson and Robert Butler
results.brief_description: Featuring a very young Kurt Russell as Dexter, student leader at Medfield College who is transformed into a human being with a hard drive memory when the computer he is repairing is unexpectedly struck by a bolt of lightning. This act of nature presents all manner of problems for Dexter as his brain begins to discover certain information about the somewhat suspect activities of the College’s rich benefactor A.J. Arno (Cesar Romero) who donated the computer in the first place. The story bounces along from adventure to adventure, revealing secrets and plans, a kidnapping and a rescue. Cast includes Joe Flynn, William Schallert, Alan Hewitt.

results.title: The Computer programme No. 6-10
results.creator_credit: BBC, Matt Boney and Frank Ash
results.brief_description: No.6 “Sound and Moving Pictures” - Shows the exciting potential of computer animation and art. No.7 “Let’s Pretend” - A lot can be learnt from an accurate model and one of the truly exciting capabilities of computers is simulation. No.8 “The Thinking Machine” - Computers can learn but this program asks if they can think. No.9 “In Control” - Shows the potential of computers to control aspects of our environment. No.10 “Things to Come” - Automation in farming and banking processes and unemployment consequences.

results.title: The Computer programme No. 1-5
results.creator_credit: BBC, Matt Boney and Frank Ash
results.brief_description: This ten part series which presents the basic concepts of microcomputers and their effects on our lives. No.1 “It’s Happening Now” - Explores the abilities of computers and shows how much a part of everyday life they have already become. No.2 “One Thing After Another” - Explains that a computer program is simply a logical set of instructions. No.3 “Talking to a Machine” - A computer language like BASIC is more like English than at first thought. No.4 “It’s on the Computer” - The storage of information and how to access it. Shows the British Museum Science Reference Library and a modern hospital where a Commodore PET is seen in operation. No.5 “The New Media” - Computer uses for our daily needs at home and in the office.

results.title: The Compleat schooling
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, David H. Fowler and Rupert Glover
results.brief_description: Freyberg Memorial School, in Te Atatu, near Auckland, has become an important community centre. Teachers and parents have extended the school’s function to make it an exciting place where adults and youngsters are involved in many activities outside the mainstream of education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, David H. Fowler and Rupert Glover

results.title: The Compleat Beatles
results.brief_description: The “Rockumentary” relives the legend of the Beatles, from the wild exuberance of the early Cavern Club days through eight incredible years to the grim finality of “Let It Be”. John, Paul, George and Ringo are seen in performance, on tour, in films, recording with George Martin and in rare footage never before seen. Features excerpts from many of their songs. Rated: PG

results.title: The Competitive spirit (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
Deals with one of the best known and least documented problems of corporate management: status-seeking, empire-building and interdepartmental politics. Stimulates managers and executives to look at their behavior, their motives and the problems of corporate communication in a new light. Cast: John Cleese, Antony Jay.

results.title: The Competitive Edge
results.brief_description: A study of Victoria’s economic strategy for growth which singles out areas of competitive strength. The nine areas selected for government support include: 1)industrial skills; 2)commercial centre; 3)research capability; 4)brown coal; 5)off shore oil; 6)agriculture; 7)location centrality; 8)national role as cultural and commercial centre; 9)tourism.

results.title: The Compenius Organ in Denmark
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Christen Jul
results.brief_description: At Frederiksborg Palace is the famous organ constructed in wood by Esaias Compenius of Brunswick. Kept in working order since 1610, it is a living witness to the love of music which enriched the reign of Christian IV. In the film, the music of Buxtehude (who had considerable influence on J.S. Bach) brings out many of its unique beauties. Tapestries by Hans Kneiper, included in the film, illustrate daily life of the 17th century.
